examples.romaji_meaning: Daiku (Carpenter) no shigoto (work) wa taihen (difficult) desu (is)

examples.sentence: 雪の上に足跡があります
examples.romaji: Yuki no ue ni ashiato ga arimasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Yuki (Snow) no ue (on top) ni ashiato (footprints) ga arimasu (there are)
examples.english: There are footprints on the snow.

examples.sentence: 婚約おめでとうございます

examples.english: I work at a trading company.

examples.sentence: この商社は大きいです
examples.romaji_meaning: Kono (This) shousha (trading company) wa ookii (big) desu (is)

examples.sentence: 初級クラスで勉強します
examples.english: I study in a beginner class.

examples.sentence: 期待を失望させないでください
examples.romaji_meaning: Kitai (Expectation) o shitsubou (disappointment) sasenaide (do not cause) kudasai (please)

examples.sentence: 友人の見舞いに行きます
examples.english: I go to visit my friend.

examples.sentence: お見舞い申し上げます

examples.english: I go to the summit of the mountain.

examples.sentence: 頂上からの眺めは素晴らしいです
examples.romaji: Choujou kara no nagame wa subarashii desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Choujou (Summit) kara no nagame (view) wa subarashii (wonderful) desu (is)
examples.english: The view from the summit is wonderful.

examples.sentence: 上品な話し方をします
examples.romaji_meaning: Jouhin (Elegant) na hanashikata (way of speaking) o shimasu (do)

examples.sentence: 盗難に注意してください
examples.romaji_meaning: Tounan (Theft) ni chuui (caution) shite kudasai (please pay)

examples.sentence: 盗難事件がありました
毎度ありがとうございます
毎度お世話になります
examples.romaji_meaning: Maido (Every time) osewa ni narimasu (receive care)
examples.english: Thank you for your continued support.

examples.sentence: 掲示板に書いてあります
examples.romaji_meaning: Keijiban (Notice board) ni kaite arimasu (is written)
examples.english: It is written on the notice board.

examples.sentence: 薬品に注意してください
examples.romaji_meaning: Yakuhin (Chemicals) ni chuui (caution) shite kudasai (please pay)
examples.english: Please be careful with the chemicals.

examples.sentence: プレゼントを頂戴しました
この部分は省いてください
examples.romaji: Kono bubun wa ha buite kudasai
examples.romaji_meaning: Kono (This) bubun (part) wa ha buite (omit) kudasai (please)
Kodomo (Child) ga abarate imasu (is acting wildly)

examples.sentence: 厳重に注意してください
examples.romaji_meaning: Genjuu (Strict) ni chuui (caution) shite kudasai (please pay)

examples.sentence: 税関で止められました

examples.english: I get off at the station.

examples.sentence: 停電に注意してください
examples.romaji_meaning: Teiden (Power outage) ni chuui (caution) shite kudasai (please pay)
examples.english: Please be careful of power outages.

examples.sentence: ここは有名な名所です
examples.romaji: Koko wa yuumei na meisho desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Koko (Here) wa yuumei (famous) na meisho (famous place) desu (is)

examples.sentence: 気圧が低いと雨が降ります
examples.romaji: Kiatsu ga hikui to ame ga furimasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Kiatsu (Atmospheric pressure) ga hikui (low) to ame (rain) ga furimasu (falls)
examples.english: When the atmospheric pressure is low, it rains.
I go to the library room.

examples.romaji_meaning: Tosho shitsu (Library room) wa shizuka (quiet) desu (is)

examples.romaji: Jishuu shitsu wa doko desu ka?
examples.romaji_meaning: Jishuu shitsu (Study room) wa doko (where) desu ka (?)

examples.sentence: この計算は引き算です
この計算は足し算です
十分な休養が必要です
examples.romaji: Juubun na kyuuyou ga hitsuyou desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Juubun (Sufficient) na kyuuyou (rest) ga hitsuyou (necessary) desu (is)
Ikken (At first glance) kantan sou (looks easy) desu ga (but)
examples.english: At first glance, it looks easy, but...

examples.sentence: 一見の価値があります
examples.romaji_meaning: Ikken (Once) no kachi (value) ga arimasu (there is)

examples.english: I felt excited about the match.
